articles.title: Colossal one-million-mile-long plume shooting out from the sun' is captured by astrophotgrapher - Daily Mail
articles.description: Andrew McCarthy told DailyMail.com witnessing the giant prominence and one-million-mile-long 'are the moments solar astronomers live for.'  He watched the event for six hours.
articles.content:
An amateur astrophotogropher pointed his telescope toward the sun and observed a plume shooting out from the fiery surface at 100,000 miles per hour as it grew to more than one million miles long.
